_header: O good Lord that knowest all thing
Subjects: confession; women, canonesses; St. Augustine, rule of
_description: Form of confession for a female Augustinian — two quatrains

CULAdd3042.Transcription:
[O] good lorde that knowest all thyngwhom I offende fro day to
                    daythy swete mercy ȝette on me spryngand my defautes to knowe all
                    wayTo thi mercy be I meke ay[and] in full hope to haue itwith all
                    my mend thus I the prayeto thyn owne love make thu me knyt.
CULAdd3042.Editions:
Barratt,  Alexandra. 
             “Books for Nuns: Cambridge University Library MS Additional
                3042.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n. s. 44 (1996): 310-19: 315.
